intro: Drosanthemum ambiguum, commonly known as the variable drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which come in shades of yellow, orange, and red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Drosanthemum ambiguum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
